meanings.definition: A short, sharp cry or yelp, especially of pain or fear.
meanings.sent1: When the puppy got scared, it let out a yipe.
meanings.sent2: The yipe of the child alerted everyone to the danger.
meanings.sent3: The yipe of the squirrel made the forest seem alive.
meanings.sent4: Her yipe echoed through the empty hallway, startling everyone.
meanings.sent5: The yipe pierced the silence, sending shivers down their spines.

meanings.sent1: She would often yipe when surprised by sudden noises.
meanings.sent2: The dog would yipe happily when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent3: He would yipe playfully during their games of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The bird yiped in delight as it flew freely in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The child yiped with joy as they rode the rollercoaster.

meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp movement or action.
meanings.sent1: The yipe of the rabbit caught the fox's attention.
meanings.sent2: With a yipe, she dodged the falling branch just in time.
meanings.sent3: The yipe of the car's brakes saved them from a collision.
meanings.sent4: His yipe of surprise caused him to drop the fragile vase.
meanings.sent5: The sudden yipe of the wind blew the leaves in all directions.
